conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D. Predict which container (E, F or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Streams A, B, C, and D are the starting points of the liquid.
Stream A and B strike the orange slanted barrier and are deflected to the left.
Stream C impacts the grey slanted barrier and turns right.
Stream D encounters the blue baffle and is deflected to the right.

premise: Stream A and B strike the orange slanted barrier and are deflected to the left.
conclusion: Mixture of A and B hugs the left wall and flows straight down.

premise: Stream C impacts the grey slanted barrier and turns right.
conclusion: Stream C first flows along the grey baffle, then hits the red slanted barrier and deflects to the left.

premise: Stream D encounters the blue baffle and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Stream D hugs the right wall and flows straight down.

premise: Mixture of A and B hugs the left wall and flows straight down.
conclusion: All stream A and most of B end in container E with some liquid from B reaches F.

premise: Stream C first flows along the grey baffle, then hits the red slanted barrier and deflects to the left.
conclusion: Stream C ends in container F.

premise: Stream D hugs the right wall and flows straight down.
conclusion: Stream D ends in container G.

premise: All stream A and most of B end in container E with some liquid from B reaches F; stream C ends in container F; stream D ends in container G.
